Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!clean,cheap,nice location!!”
Reviews.Author: Naoko0516
Reviews.Content: nice location where can go almost anywhere in center of Madrid.room was so clean as Japan's hotel.comfortable roon We slept very well.thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GoMarshy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so close to the Plaza Mayor and Mercado de San Miguel (the fantastic food court) we could see them from our window so it's a great location for central Madrid. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was very good, especially the shower which was one of the best I've experienced in a hotel. For 7 euros you can have the buffet breakfast which has cereal, fruit, cold meat and cheese and a selection of hot dishes together with freshly squeezed orange juice, great value and a good way to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Caz2468
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a long weekend in Madrid for a hen party with 17 girls! This hotel was perfect! The rooms are really modern and clean and such good value for money. The location is great as it's right opposite the lovely Plaza Mayor and the amazing San Miguel Market. The market is a lovely place to get your breakfast, lunch or dinner! The only slight problem is that there was only a small bathroom mirror so when two girls are trying to get ready it was a battle for the mirror! And a double room is quite small and the bathroom door is glass (not totally see-through) so doesn't provide much privacy! But overall I was really pleased we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and high quality hotel, shame about the reception and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Choogster
Reviews.Content: Spent a very pleasant 2 nights in the Palace Mayor, a very modern and comfortable hotel with fantastic rooms and showers. Only a couple of drawbacks. The receptionist were lousy and typically Spanish in their service - arrogant and rude (except for Jose, who was great! You can find this guy on the early morning shift) And the breakfast - or what they like to call it. Even though its on special offer (reduced to 7e from 15) it was probably the worst breakfast I've ever had in any hotel. I wouldn't even pay 1e for this kind of rubbish. Scrambled egg with no taste, bacon which was barely cooked, the only thing worth eating was the baked beans which came out of a tin. Also, as a side note, avoid eating in any of the restaurants in the area - except for the Mercado across the street (amazing place) or the restaurant in El Corte Ingles (top floor of the main store). The tourist restaurants are complete rubbish, tasteless food, bad service and like to rip off the unsuspecting tourist (which we found to our cost when they showed a handwritten receipt adding an extra 15e for no reason).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: On arrival at midnight, we were greated by a very friendly receptionist who had already set up the air conditioning in our room (it was 35 degrees the weekend we stayed), created our wi-fi account and gathered all our paperwork prior to our arrival. She also gave us 2 keys and advised us to leave one in the key card holder in the room to keep the Air Con on all day "otherwise you will melt". Excellent service. We only stayed 2 nights and didn't have breakfast, so I can only comment on the room, which was clean and tidy and had its own laptop which was free to use. Again, excellent. The location was perfect as well. 20 metres from the Indoor Market and the entrance to Plaza Mayor (the other side of Sol). The only negative of the trip was that the air con was a bit loud at night but, again, it was 35 degrees so it was working pretty hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto V
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, especially for the price. The hotel is very well situated: across the street from the wonderful San Miguel market and only a few blocks from Cava Baja street and the Plaza de La Paja (with wonderful bars and restaurants for nightlife), and across the street from the incomparable Plaza Mayor, the grandest of Madrid's plazas. The rooms are clean, have laptops and free wifi, and the breakfast is fine. The staff speak English and are helpful. The hotel has a modernist chic look to it (the hallways look like corridors of a fancy space station, oddly), and overall is pretty cool. Great location, clean, and quiet. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great value”
Reviews.Author: anotherheaven2007
Reviews.Content: Basic tourist hotel, but very clean and very helpful staff. Free wifi and computer in the room a good bonus. Very handy to Calle Mayor and the Mercato which was wonderful. Small rooms but have everything you need. Would certainly recommend for good value. Got a very good 2 for 1 breakfast deal which was surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “best location very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aenjels
Reviews.Content: in short, very good room, clean, nice staff, great location. the only minus is the breakfast room which is small and noisy but breakfast quality itself was good

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: Katriina_H
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel somewhere between average and very good. Location is perfect, so perhaps I could say it was very good over all. I stayed at the hotel with my sister, we attended a wedding in Chinchon. Couple of things decreased our mood, but that wasn't the hotels's fault. My sister got her wallet stolen in the metro on our way from the airport to the hotel and during the first night someone was knocking on our door several times, and finally slipped a receipt (??!) under our door. We couldn't sleep anyway (because of the wallet and noise from the street) and this knock on the door made us feel freeky. I think the mattress was too hard. Other than that our room was just a regular hotel room, nothing so very special. Spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: ic060
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights after staying somewhere further out, and this place was great. Room: Perfectly adequate. The wallpaper and carpets looked slighty worn and tatty, and the chair felt like it was about to break as it was so flimsy. My only other complaint is the pillows, they were so hard and flat that I ended up using the scatter cushions to sleep on instead. Other than these things it was great. The big rain shower was amazing, the bed was comfy, the air con/heating was very good. I didn't use the laptop in the room as I had my own, but the free wifi was good if a little slow. Hotel: The staff were very friendly, spoke perfect English and were very happy to store my bags for my last day after I checked out. I've no doubt they would have helped me with any other problems. It's called a high tech hotel though I must say, other than having a laptop in the room, I struggled to notice anything particuarly high tech. The decor makes it seem a bit sci-fi, but it was clean and smart. Location: Can't be faulted, right next to the Plaza Mayor and also the AMAZING food market of San Miguel just across the road. An absolute must for tapas, wine, snacks and lovely biscuits, olives and meats to take home. The atmosphere is great though it does get very crowded later on in the evenings. There are several metro stops all within easy reach, as well as several high street shopping thoroughfares. My wallet wasn't too happy about the location, but I definitely was! The entrance is on the main Calle Mayor, so coming and going late at night after the bars and clubs felt very safe, and there were always taxis on hand just outside the hotel which was great for getting to places further afield. The palace (and its wonderful gardens) are a short walk down Calle Mayor. All in all this was a really good choice for a long weekend in Madrid. I wanted to be able to walk everywhere and I certainly could. There were plenty of restaurants, shops and sights nearby and I would probably stay here again if I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “BEST location to explore city and SUPER friendly / helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cubanjimbo
Reviews.Content: After two different stays at this hotel in May 2012, I can certify that the staff is one of the best and most helpful I have ever seen in my European travels. The hotel areas and rooms were very clean and high-tech. The in-room laptop was a great touch with free internet access (including wifi). Very highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem in the heart of old town madrid”
Reviews.Author: farry14
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 30-ish year old lads heading over to madrid for a long birthday celebration weekend which was booked rather last minute and we took what we could find at a reasonable price. however, I cant praise the hotel and it's location enough. location is perect, room was fine and the bathroom was very modern (shower was ace). we had three lads sharing a room and would have really settled for whatever but it was spot on. the staff were very friendly and always took the time to point us in the right direction. check it out its the perfect base for wine and tapas!! you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: iguana_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week. The Hotel was well positioned, a short walk from the Plaza, the Palace and many other sights, not to mention the numerous shops and restaurants. If you turn left from the hotel there was also an excellent cafe serving churros and chocolate, a must for any Madrid stay! We had a 3 bed room which was small but comfortable. The 3rd bed was not a rollaway bed but a comfortable single. The bathroom was modern with an excellent shower. A plentiful, varied breakfast buffet was available. The only gripe was that the heating was on soo high that the room was stuffy and we had to open the window to let in some air. Would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinty0105
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 3 days on a short city break and enjoyed the hotel and area very much. The hotel is so central, just a short walk from Sol and across the road from Plaza Mayor. The hotel is very modern with a laptop in the room for free use if required.Only a couple of criticisms, one was when we went into the room it had an unpleasant smell,it was like a dirty drain smell. However, when we ran off the water the smell did subside.I think that maybe the room had not been used for a few days hense the smell. The second was that there was a huge stain on the carpet which really needs to be addressed, but It certaily did not put us off the staying there. We did not eat breafast in the hotel so I cannot comment on it, we just went to local cafes which were great value for money. The Market across the road is just fantastic, the tapas are amazing and the fresh fruit superb. On one of our days we did the Bravo bike tour, which again was a great experience. Madrid is not really a bike freandly city but Geyza (spelling)! our Hungarian tour guide was brilliant. He even came to lunch with us to translate and help us with ordering lunch(as our spannish is not too good). I would really recommend doing the tour as you get a great feel for the city, which is beautiful. We also went to the Bernabeu Stadium and did the tour which again was great value for money at 16 euros. Madrid is a beautiful city and very inexpensive. We would definately love to return and explore some more.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaliThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family, husband and two kids (10 and 12 years old) in Madrid. We stayed at Petit Palace Mayor hotel in a 4-bed family room, which was very big and very convenient for us four, with a huge bathroom, with bathtub and shower too. Generally, it was clean (apart from the moquette which was full of stains!!). Modern decoration, free internet and laptop in the room, and a minibar were the pros of the room. Ours was on the fourth floor and it was bigger than our friends' on the seventh floor, which did not have a bathtub. Staff was friendly and although we could not do late check out, they offered to keep our luggage in the hotel until our departure, after 12pm. For a family, I thing it is a very suitable hotel, centrally located and with a very reasonable price. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to land”
Reviews.Author: inspaininthemembrane
Reviews.Content: As I have said before, conditions have much to do with the experience, meaning what state of mind you arrive in and what is offered to you can really effect one's opinion. After a 24 hour delayed flight out of the US, showing up here was a great start to our trip in Spain. The desk staff exhibited everything I would come to love about Spain: intelligence, personality, and pride without pretension. They checked us in early, which is a real boon when you arrive 6 hours ahead of your check in time and you can't figure out what day it is. The room was small but efficient, nice lay out, and cozy and clean. Free wi-fi. Bathroom was perfect. The room was very very quiet. I slept for hours here. The little breakfast they offer down stairs is very good and an easy way to start the day. It will be much cheaper than going across the street to the market, especially if you are from the US and used to a larger breakfast than what the Spaniards tend to eat. The location is aces. You are a nice walk to the Prado, there's a nice market across the street that really comes alive after 10pm. You can just wander around ordering little tapas and sipping on real nice regional wines. If you duck left onto a side street coming out of the hotel, you can get lost in Madrid's maze of streets with an endless amount of steps to take. The whole experience here was a real nice way to start a trip to Spain, and again, the staff is friendly and genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: AJZ
Reviews.Content: Very central location and 30 second walk to the metro station Sevilla. There is a Starbucks across the street. Efficient check in and friendly helpful staff. Rooms were modern, boutique style. Shower was adequate but body jet were not much use for me as I am a bit short and I ended up with my faced being blasted with water. Good water pressure and big shower. No sound proofing in the room. I was at the end of the second floor and was woken up each morning with the doors banging shut, maids cleaning or traffic outside. Beds were very hard. Too hard for me. Air con was in a timer in my room. It would go off during the night and I would wake up very hot. Switch it on and then it would go off again. I was in a group and this was mentioned by other members of my group who had other rooms. Didn't enjoy breakfast at all. There was adequate selection, but nothing special. Not sure if I will return as there are plenty hotels in the area where the soundproofing would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, stylish, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: hs_prd
Reviews.Content: Small-ish hotel, very central - across the road from Plaza Mayor and about 5-10 minutes walk to Sol. Nothing in the way of amenities, but rooms are very stylishly decorated and include a laptop. Bathroom was great and has the best shower I've ever seen. Only complaint with the room was it was very small - OK when you're alone, but it was a double and it would be a bit of a squeeze if 2 people were in there. Corridors are bizarrely decorated to look like something out of a science fiction film, all grey doors with "futuristic" style numbering. Breakfast was as much as you could eat, good selection of hot & cold meats, cheese, fruit etc. Checkout was painful as there was only one person on reception, but that's what you get in a small hotel I suppose. Overall a very good hotel and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location!”
Reviews.Author: Almagetty
Reviews.Content: Talk about a central location! I always try to choose hotels that are well located in relation to sights, restaurants, etc., but this is for sure the most centrally located hotel I have ever had the good fortune to stay at. Directly across the street from the Plaza Mayor, within a couple of blocks of Puerta del Sol in one direction and the Palacio Real in the other. The Cava Baja street with all of it's wonderful tapas bars is right outside the hotel's front door. The Mercado de San Miguel across the street is also a lively place for tapas and drinks in the evening. We had one of the family rooms that accommodates 4, with a queen sized bed and bunks. Our family of 4 (parents and 2 young adult daughters) was very comfortable. The room was clean and in good condition. The computer in the room is a nice touch. We were lucky enough to be on the top floor and had a balcony with a lovely view out across Mayor. I loved the shower in the bathroom with all the jets. I'm trying to get one like it installed in my bathroom at home. I had read with concern the reviews of the bathroom with the glass doors. I'm happy to report that , although our bathroom did indeed have a swinging glass door, the glass was smoked in all the right places and there was no problem with privacy in the bathroom for us. We walked everywhere, but taxi's were always easily available, too. The hotel was running a 2 for 1 special for breakfast and we ate there on our last morning because of an early flight. It's an okay deal at 2 for 1, but is definitely way overpriced if you pay full price. For our other breakfasts, we walked down the street (exit the hotel and walk about a block to the left) and had a very reasonably priced breakfast at a Denny's type place called VIP (I think). It was nothing to write home about, but it fulfilled it's purpose. Two small gripes ... the hotel charged my card in dollars instead of Euro's without asking what my preference was. I always get a better exchange from my credit card company than the exchange I get from the European banks, so I ended up losing a few dollars in the transaction. And, the hotel is apparently very stingy when it comes to toilet paper. With 4 people in the room, we ran out of toilet paper on the second night and had to call down for more. They brought us one roll and the cleaning person never put in a spare roll, so by the fourth day we were out of paper again. The other people in our traveling party had a similar problem. Other than that, I really liked this place. When I go back to Madrid (which I hope is very soon) I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with style galore!”
Reviews.Author: tclearyn3
Reviews.Content: We had 3 adults and one pre-teen for this stay, which was only for one night, our last in Madrid. The location is central, it literally is within steps of the Plaza Mayor, which makes dining options and walking options for touring around as easy as just stepping outdoors! We didn't encounter any loud street noise during the night and slept like babies! The "Hi tech" features of this boutique style hotel were great, ultra modern feeling & hip! The lighting was cool, the halls took on hues of fuschia and blue at night! Our rooms were fantastic, especially by European standards! Full size bunk beds, that still seemed sleek and cool with their own lights, a murphy bed and our HUGE Queen were ample for us. We had 2 FULL bathrooms & the showers were AMAZING!! great water pressure, lots of gadgets, felt like the Mazarati of showers! We did do the hotel breakfast in the morning before heading to the airport and although "hot" items were featured, such as eggs, everything seemed luke warm. The only downfall to our stay would have to be that meal. We paid approx. $15 USD per person & didn't feel as though we got our monies worth (we travel a lot & are used to Euro breakfasts but this one was weak compared to many we had elsewhere in spanish hotels). Loved the hotel, skip the meal :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location- good size room”
Reviews.Author: Rejot
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk everywhere from this hotel. We took the metro from the airport and was only 2 short blocks from hotel. Great indoor market across the street- laundromat around the corner-shopping close by. Breakfast was really good! Our room was a little "run down" marks on the walls and carpet had stains- but overall great place.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL - MINIMALISTIC AND VERY CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: Bigglesofarabia
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a Friday night., Front desk staff very obliging and room was beautifully furnished and minimalistic. Just 50 metres from Mercado de San Miguel and 5 minute walk from Puerta del Sol. Bed was very comfortable and laptop provided was a great touch. Breakfast (included) was good and plentiful. Only complaint that on the LCD TV English language was limited to CNN only!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel, good for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Bazinga40
Reviews.Content: We usually don't write reviews, however, regularly use Trip Advisor when selecting a hotel. The reason for writing this review is to note the assistance of the gentleman at reception who assisted us with making a reservation at a restaurant and assisted us to locate our lost luggage from Iberian Airlines. He was most courteous and helpful. This hotel is a mid-range priced boutique hotel, well located very near the Plaza Mayor and other major sights. There are some nice restaurants and patisseries nearby. We chose this hotel because of its location and because it could accommodate a family in the one room. The room was clean, modern and tidy. The computer with internet access was useful and the fruit at reception is a nice touch. It was unusual to not have tea and coffee making facilities and the basins didn't have plugs. Other than that, we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: Palins_Pal
Reviews.Content: I really want to like this hotel, but there are niggles albeit small ones. Travelled here on business for two nights sharing twin room with colleague. Check in was frosty, and receptionist seemed surprised that two male colleagues would share a room, obviously obvilious to the current financial climate. Had to insist on twin as online booking system did not allow to specify room type. Room ok aircon, flatscreen opening windows, laptop. Very nice and with a totally fantastic hydro shower in the bathroom. First problem 'no hangers' second problem ' no iron or board', having to travel with hand luggage does not keep clothing ideally and business attire required attention. Colleague went down to reception to enquire regarding these items to be told that the previous occupants must have stolen the hangers and that THE iron was in use, and its location unknown? Strange! The iron never appeared during the two days and feel that for a alleged 4 star hotel to have 1 iron is quite frankly pathetic! (Oh, the hangers did arrive!) This place is let down on the little things, very poor staff, lack of basic items(IRONS) and it is a shame because these are the easiest to fix and would suggest lack of effort! On the plus side the location is fab! with plaza mayor on your doorstep and the rooms are great if over techy, but feel once you scratch the surface it all begins to unravel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Cathy31088
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel was not much to speak of. We were very skeptical on arrival. The entry and what little there was of a lobby was new although not impressive. The employees were nice and polite. They always had a nice bowl of fruit on the counter which was a good snack. As we entered the elevator and went to our room we were not certain if we had entered maybe a space ship. It was very modern, grey, black and dark with blue lights. The room was neat and clean but dark, grey, black and sparse. There was a computer in the room and a flat screen TV. There was no mirror except a small one over the sink in the bathroom. The hot water was on a timer so in needing to get up at 6am the water was cold. Although the shower was excellent. The room was rather dark and depressing and had blue lights over the bed. The location was perfect in the old town area. Right across from the Market and Mayor Plaza with a close walk to Puerto del Sol. There was even a grocery store for snacks and drinks only a half block away. The breakfast was good but expensive. This property might appeal to men but not especially to ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: lucyh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Palace Plaza Major from 22/10/10 to 24/10/10 and were not dissaponted. The hotel entrance is hard to find (opposite the Plaza Major and opposite the San Miguel Market (which incidentially is a fantastic market selling all sorts of food and is covered). The hotel is certainly high tech and has been modernised recently, there is a laptop in each room, a mini-bar, a fantastic bathroom with power shower and some confortable beds. The breakfast was good, but as there was only one person working in the restaurant the food took a while to come out (hot food) and the other bits were replenshed when the poor person had time. The receptionist was very friendly, they did forget to fix our hairdryer despite asking twice but thats the only problem we had. It was easy to catch a metro from the airport to the hotel (2 euros and 2 changes) and the tour bus stops in the puerto del sol (down the road from the hotel). Overall an excellent two days!

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4 stars hotel...Don`t stay or you will be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: SmartTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but the room is dirty and hot...The air-con does not work. I asked the reception why it is so hot which she suggested to open the windows..which is so noisy and dirty. The worst is the design of the bathroom where the floor will get flooded after taking a bath or shower.... Will definitely not be coming back. I would not recommend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Decor, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mstraveler38
Reviews.Content: So first off, we came to Madrid after a stay in Barcelona and neither of the hotels offered conditioner! The hotel is decorated very nicely and we had a very fast check in unlike some other hotels. The hotel is a little hidden as it is narrow and our taxi driver almost passed it and called it the hidden hotel. The location is great. Right across from Plaza Mayor and a spectacular market. The market had great foods, tapas, fruits, and homemade potato chips. It as a great place to eat lunch or dinner. The rooms in the hotel were decorated nicely but had no balcony and no particular views. The televisions were nice - flatscreens - and there was a laptop in every room and free wifi. Our laptop was missing the mouse button so it was a little hard to use. I also brought my own laptop but got no wireless connection on it so I unplugged the internet wire going into the room's laptop and stuck it in my own. That worked until the last day where it just stopped working. A positive for this hotel is that the showers are very cool. They had three different options. A standard shower head like rain, a movable one, and a system of jets. Overall good hotel with a good feel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: Ahalin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (but no views to speak off), satisfactory rooms although quite small for a new hotel, with a modernist theme. The free breakfast, high speed wireless and laptop were a nice touch. The staff spoke English which was a relief because not many people do, despite the heavy tourist presence. On the average side were the small things such as tiny bottles of cheap shampoo, the aircon wasn't cold (and quite noisy) and breakfast (7.30 - 10.30) was not replenished. Get there by 9.30 if you want hot foods. Although there was a mini bar in the room it was expensive (Euro 4.80 for a small beer that sells for 0.50 in the supermarket) and there was no bottle opener to be had for love nor money in the whole hotel. Madrid loves their corked wine so this can be a problem: If you want to BYO and don't mind looking like a wino, ask the shop to open it before going home or buy your own corkscrew (although none to be had in the local supermarkets or souvenir shops! Despite the double glazing the lower floors suffer some traffic noise (particularly out the back where the road paving is lifting) The heavy internal doors all close with a slam so quite a bit of hallway noise too. The staff were reasonably helpful but not as good as some we have seen. So, not bad, and can't fault the location but not deserving of the five star rating yet.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 4* hotels - Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Amit P
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TripAdvisor made me book this hotel and it was a decision well made. The best part was the front-desk staff who advised us on best places to see, eat and hangout.... and all the advice we asked them for. We reached Madrid early morning by the overnight Trenhotel from Lisbon and the hotel staff were quite helpful in taking care of our luggage and giving us advice on where to hangout while they prepared a room for us. Pictures can't do justice to the wonderful room we had. We never thought black and white could make up such a nice chic room. We booked a romantic package which came with chocolates and a bottle of cava. Although we had to remind them of it, we were impressed by what we got... and we got two bottles of cava instead of one. The location is excellent, about 10-minute walk from Sol train/metro station and diagonally opposite Plaza Mayor. The small market across the street was a nice one to enjoy some refreshing drinks, tapas and fresh sea food. The room was quite modern, tastefully designed in shades of black and white. The wifi is excellent and I can vouch for it because I had to urgently do some work and was able to upload a 52MB file to my office server through VPN in less than 10 minutes without the connection ever breaking. The additional laptop in the room provided by the hotel was good to engage my wife while I worked on mine. While most hotels charge for wifi, it was nice to see the hotel providing not only wifi but also a laptop in the room for personal browsing. The breakfast at the hotel was decent, nothing very great but still with a good variety. The hotel also recommended El Corral de la Morería, a nice restaurant with one of the world's best Flamenco shows, which was superb. We will definitely stay in this hotel whenever we visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingyogi
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better location. Just a short walk from Plaza Mayor, we walked all over Madrid from here. The room was a typical European size -- small -- but that's expected. The staff was pleasant and helpful, breakfast buffet was good. The best feature of the room was the windows. We could open them and hear all the lively street noise, and then close them and it was completely silent. Can't say that about most hotels we've stayed at in Madrid. The worst feature was the bathroom. The whole room is made of frosted glass. Not the shower, not the door -- the whole room. My husband and I are not prudes by any means, but we really don't need to see each other on the toilet. . . Luckily we could laugh about it. What was harder to laugh about was the fact that the shower floor wasn't separate from the rest of the bathroom, so whenever you took a shower, the entire floor would flood and you'd be sloshing around in water. We had to get extra towels to put outside the bathroom door to keep the water from coming into the bedroom. If they'd change the bathroom I'd give it 5 stars. Even so, I'm not adverse to going back. The location was fantastic and everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Chic City Break”
Reviews.Author: missnljones82
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous trip....it was a suprise weekend for our sister who has just celebrated her 30th birthday!! When we arrived at the hotel we were very happy to find our room had a balcony with panoramic views of the city. The bathrooms were fantastic, in particular the shower. The hotel is in a great location just opposite the square where you can take in the beautiful buildings whilst enjoying the local tapas. The staff were very helpful, especially the reception staff. We only had a few points, there was no tea/coffee making facilties which we found odd, the carpets could do with replacing and the ladder that leads to the top bunk could do with some cushion as it was very painful trying to climb. But overall we would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,a stones throw from the Plaza Mayor Grand Square”
Reviews.Author: SunshineLollipopsUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and convenient due to being only seconds away from the grand square everything is within walking distance,with the tube only 5 minutes walk away. The hotel room was ultra modern with a lovely large bathroom and decent shower.The bed was comfortable although the view left a little to the imagination!The breakfast spread was excellent with a wide variety to choose from. On occasions when we were unsure the staff were happy to point us the direction of places we were trying to find. The corte de ingles department store has a must visit supermarket in the basement with an excellent selection of food should you wish to buy any extras. Overall for a young couple like ourselves we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel which my family never go back”
Reviews.Author: SamASmith
Reviews.Content: My family were very unhappy with the room (Rm 409), the room was small even we paid for the family room. The floor was very dirty, the cleaning was not doing anything. The staffs of the hotel were not helpful and not friendly at all. They gave us the wrong informations about the train station as well as where to go. They don't seem to care about the guests too much. But the location of the hotel is good, nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “This is not value for money. Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is in a great location, it did not live up to the £100 a night price tag. The rooms are very small, the bed is very very hard and was not clean. The breakfast was really average. Not a fan of this hotel. Will not be back. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayL49
Reviews.Content: This was in a great location, friendly helpful staff, great room with large bathroom, laptop, breakfast was plentiful and waitress in there always helpful and cheery. Only negative thing that happened was two guys who waited until we walked in and then attempted to steal our rucksack (too bad they didn't get it, only had smelly sneakers and raincoats in it) but desk clerk prevented it. Said people wait outside many of the hotels and watch people check in. Plenty of restaurants to eat at and street artists to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna1201
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Madrid with my mother, aunt and cousin. We stayed in the Family Room which was great. The bathroom is very spacious and the hotel location was fantastic. We rarely used the metro or tax since everything was in great walking distanace. Highly recommend this hotel. Staff was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous central location”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Lamb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not actually in the Plaza Major, but on the street next to the square - 46 Calle Major. However, the room is very quiet. Very central, in walking distance of most Madrid's need-to-sees. Clean and tidy, room compact, but more than adequate for 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really can not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: DapaNewcastleEngland
Reviews.Content: I was amazed to read some negative feedback for this hotel as I was really impressed! I travel all over Europe and stay in a lot of hotels and this one was perfect. Easy to get to on the underground following the instructions the hotel provides (only €2 from the airport!) great location right in the centre of everything and you are spoilt rotten for a choice of shops, restaurant and bars but all in stunning locations! The Hotel was Wifi connected and with no charge. The bathroom was very modern and gorgeous, the bed comfy and the room, although on the small side, was perfect with really hip furnishings. I asked for a quiet room too and it was silent which is great for me being a very light sleeper. And all of this for a really cheap price of £70!! WOW! I would deffinately recommend this place to anyone wanting to come to Madrid, be it business or leisure, and will tell my sister to come on her trip next year. Great Hotel and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: manish2001
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location, friendly staff specially front desk, good breakfast, proximity to all major attraction

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Larisha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend during one weekend - it was excelent! Very bautiful and funcional rooms, all the equipment is really new - we even had a personal laptop in the room! I really enjoyed jacuzzi in the room and the matress on the bed - it helped to relax a lot. The location of the hotel is perfect - our room was overlooking Mayor Square, but it was quiet in it. All what you need you can rich by foot. The stuff is nice. we didn´t see cleaning girls, but the room was always clean and prepared by the time we were back. Reception desk is very helpful and kind: they recomended us some nice places to eat and to go out and during the stay all our question were resolved immediatly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, trendy boutique hotel, small rooms, staff average”
Reviews.Author: Silverwedding25
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful trip to beautiful Madrid with my 21 year old daughter and my sister. The hotel is very central and easy walking to all the major attractions (Plaza Mayor, Palace, Prado, Retiro Park etc) and plenty of restaurants and right beside the pedestrianized shopping streets. The hotel is very modern and the room had lovely bedlinen and plenty of towels and toiletries and a great shower. We had booked a room for three and like the previous reviewer I would have to say it was a little pokey and when the bunk bed was down it was difficult to pass by and access the bathroom (especially in the middle of the night). We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel which meant we all got a good nights sleep. The internet access was a bonus as my daughter could keep in contact with friends. The mini bar is expensive so we just bought water locally and used the fridge to cool it. I did notice a smell on one evening when we returned but it was gone after we showered and then didnt appear again. One point however we all seemed to start sneezing when we turned on the heating. I'm not sure if there was dust in the fan or in the room!! We also noticed the lack of mirrors with three of us vying for one mirror to do makeup etc it required planning but was not a major issue. The check-in was efficient but staff are a little distant and somewhat vague. On the first night we asked for restaurant recommendations and we were directed to La Latina which we were told was a short walk. I'm not sure if we got lost but we couldnt find the area and it was dark and very quiet and we decided to head back towards Sol where we found a lovely restaurant and a little buzz. The breakfast is good and as we paid while booking it cost €10 and not the €16 as advertised. Its worth 10 but not 16. Locally there are lovely pastry shops and specialist ham shops that do coffee, churros, etc which I would probably opt for when I return to Madrid. All in all Madrid is a beautiful city with a laid back atmosphere, great value for food, drink and taxis. The metro is cheap, safe and never too crowded (we bought the 3 day tourist pass at the information office just before you enter the metro in the airport, it was €11.50 and proved to be great value as it covered the journey to and from the airport and all other journeys . The lady at the desk was very helpful with directions and metro changes and even marked our hotel exactly on the map The hotel is fine and it is clean, safe and very modern and I would probably stay there again as the location is excellent. If you're not looking for engaging staff and spacious accommodation and reception rooms than you could do worse than stay here. I would have liked a bar or somewhere to have a coffee or drink after a day's sight seeing. I am planning a return trip at some stage with my husband as I know he would love Madrid. Try not to take the metro all the time as walking around is a pleasure with all the beautiful buildings and amazing little streets and artwork.

Reviews.Title: “how can this hotel have a four star rating??!”
Reviews.Author: irishpete56
Reviews.Content: no working ac no cold water (boiling water in sink, shower and toilet!!) hugley disappointing experience very average breakfast (and DEFINITELY not worth E15!!) Average location - lots of better options within five minutes walking distance in summary,it is in mayor area, but petit palais descriptor very wide of mark - makes me worry about rest of chain.....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sebhki
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week there on business. The location is superb, the room spotless, the staff friendly. Breakfast is good but for the price you might want more diversity and there are plenty of options around plaza mayor. The free computer / wlan is greatly appreciated, as well as flat screen tv with lots of -spanish- channels Bed was of great size, but the room could have been bigger. Bathroom was very large, shower too (with hydrojets). Free bike rental, and apparently some rooms feature a fitness bike (will try next time). some minor problems : - room keys are very subject to being demagnetised if you keep them in the pocket with your phone - they did not accept my diners card at checkout - aircon is noisy - no view from the room I had

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend Petit Palace Mayor Plaza”
Reviews.Author: aussieroos
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becos of its location and it didn't disappoint. Check in was relatively easy despite the fact that some roads around Plaza Mayor were closed out to accomodate crowds around Xmas time on a Sunday. Hotel staff speak good English, and are friendly and helpful (except the guy in the breakfast room). The in room PC & free minibar are definitely a bonus. The bed is of good size, nice & firm altho pillows were too soft. The room has all the basics except a full length mirror and hand or body lotion. Overall, we are very happy with the hotel and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandy08Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Just home from a 4 night stay in this hotel,great location,we stayed on a bed and breakfast tarriff ,the breakfast has a good selection should be something for everyone, When we arrived we booked in straight away no delays and the staff very nice and helpful. The room was really nice, large clean shower room a plus.Aircon was good ,the view was not great but in a city like Madrid you wont be in the room looking out the window.Great eating places so close never found somewhere to complain about. The bed in the room was very large and very comfortable and having a laptop a definate plus to keep up with Emails.etc. All staff were very nice the young concierge on the door can recomend places to go and eat so very helpful.I would recomend the bus tour also metro clean and easy to use. All said I would go back to this hotel and probably will ,my only bad coment is no full length mirror !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: ask_a_local
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 4 day break in Madrid - what a great city! We chose the Petit Palace Mayor partly due to its location and this didn't disappoint. On the Calle Mayor, yards from the Plaza Mayor and within minutes of 2 metro stations (Sol & Opera), shops, bars restaurants and tourist attractions. The hotel itself only opened a month ago and appears to have got over the teething problems mentioned in the previous review. Check-in was swift and courteous and we only experienced one minor problem with our door key. We found the room to be of a reasonable size (particularly for a city centre). The decor and lighting were modern and well thought out. The bed was huge and comfortable while storage was just enough for a break of this size. The laptop in the room was useful for checking emails and getting tourist information. Although we had a limited roof top view this was not a real concern. The lack of street noise more than made up for it. The windows gave good sound insulation so I wouldn't expect the front-facing rooms to have any problems. The shower-room was of a good size with high quality fittings including a multi-function shower. Towels were also of a high quality. We booked directly with hthoteles.com and paid €570 for the four nights including breakfast and VAT. Booking breakfast this way cost €10 rather than €15 if paid later. There was more than adequate variety available and the breakfast room was bright and modern. Downsides? My wife noticed the lack of a full length mirror in the bedroom (there was plenty of wall space for one) while I felt that the quality of the toileteries fell short of the quality of the shower room itself. These are minor quibbles but rectifying them would have turned a good hotel to a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dgm2712
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at Petit Palace Mayor. I have returned with mixed feels which I will try and explain through this review. Firstly when booking and looking more information on the hotel I googled the hotel and could never find many hits apart from information pages from the likes of Expedia/lastminute etc. For reference the hotel is owned by a chain called High Tech Hotels ([-]). The location was great, a minutes walk from Plaza Mayor (http://www.multimap.com/s/B8Y9hQGe) where you can enjoy a number of tapas bars and sit and people watch till your hearts content. 5/10 mins walk down Calle Mayor is the Royal Palace and Catedral de la Almudena. Around 20 mins walk in the other direction is the Museo del Prado. You are also a short walk from the Sol metro station. On arrival it took 30/40 mins to check-in which was a joke especially when we arrived at 2am after a delayed flight. The guy on the desk seemed to have technical (or other!) issues using either PC he had access too. Anyway got checked in and allocated room 110, the room was clean (the hotel is brand new) but small. There was enough room to walk around the bed and that was it. If you are staying here for more than 2 nights you might want to upgrade to a larger family room. The bathoom was good, huge shower (rainfall shower head), contemporary fittings (all from Porcelanosa) and almost the size of the bedroom. You will noticed everything they could get away with they branded. Even down to the Dell laptops they have in each room. The view out the room was terrible, onto the other side of the hotel, if you opened the window and stuck your head out you could see the sky. It was unclear during our stay if any rooms had views down Calle Mayor, it looked like just the main areas. which would be great shame. When we had booked the hotel we had taken up the offer (available from Expedia and lastminute) for an upgrade to a hydromassage bath and free soft drinks. This is far from worth it, all rooms have a hydromassage showers anyway and the free soft drinks were two bottles of 500ml water. Expedia and lastminute also claim there is an informal bar at this hotel, this is not the case. Checking the official hotel website it does not advertise this. We never had breakfast in the hotel but the couple we were with went the first morning and it was nothing write home about, for 15 euros each it was better to go and explore and enjoy breakfast at a traditional Madrid cafe. As the hotel is new there are a few teething issues, one major one was that the couple we were with had continual door issues. Each time they returned to the room it took up to 5 new swipe cards to get into their room. Going up and down from the 4th floor you can understand their frustration. Hopefully this was a one off or they are in the process of sorting this. Note - For readers arriving into Madrid Barajas and getting a taxi be aware a lot of sites that say it is a 20 euro trip into Madrid. This wasn't the case for us. Always ask how much it will be before getting in a taxi, we were first quoted 50 euros but haggled down to 35 euro. On arriving at the hotel we noticed the meter said just over 20 euros, he claimed airport supplements etc made it 35 euros. We took the metro back to the airport, 2 euros 90 cents each and two changes, dead easy and only 20/25 mins. All in all the hotel was okay for a night or twos stay but no longer. As with all new hotels there are teething issues, they need to sort the check-in process and ensure all the door swipe cards work first time. The hotel was great from a location point of view. Still unclear how they class this as a 4* hotel, it has no bar or restaurant (lunch or dinner), no room service, staff who need properly trained and small bedrooms. It seemed to be classed as 4* due to the hotel being brand new. Will be looking elsewhere next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Petit Palace Mayor
HotelInfo.Address: Mayor 46 | Centro Histórico, 28013 Madrid, Spain
